data.title: WinRT and iOS Fixes
data.body:
Fixed some missing usings releated to the DataContext attributes.

Some fixes related to the background GL context for iOS.

Fixed cast in iOS GamePad.

WinRT apps now get LaunchParameters.

http://monogame.codeplex.com/workitem/6971

data.body:
Already reported issue here with some details on how to fix it:
http://monogame.codeplex.com/workitem/6986
however, since that tracker seems to be inactive, I'm reposting this here.

data.title: Fixed the namespaces for SongReader and SoundEffectReader for Android
data.body:
Fixed the namespaces for SongReader and SoundEffectReader for Android

http://monogame.codeplex.com/workitem/6680

data.title: Serializable attribute missing on many classes
data.body:
I hope I'm doing everything right. It's my first time on github, so please tell me if i'm doing something wrong.
This patch is basically just introducing some [Serializable] attributes that are present in XNA and should also be there in MonoGame (I know it's not much, but as soon as I get used to git, more will come in the future).

data.title: VertexDeclaration uses GL11 only
data.body:
Taken from my post on CodePlex: http://monogame.codeplex.com/workitem/6994

VertexDeclaration.cs (MonoGame 2.5) only uses GL11. When using GL2.0 this causes:

06-15 14:37:12.460 E/libEGL  (14673): called unimplemented OpenGL ES API
06-15 14:37:12.460 E/libEGL  (14673): called unimplemented OpenGL ES API
06-15 14:37:12.480 E/libEGL  (14673): called unimplemented OpenGL ES API
06-15 14:37:12.480 E/libEGL  (14673): called unimplemented OpenGL ES API

And, of course, all of the images/textures are invisible.

data.title: Project template and deployment fixes for Linux
data.body:
These commits ensure that if a Linux user installs MonoDevelop.MonoGame and creates a new project, hitting compile then run will work:
- Provide a pkg-config package file, for MonoDevelop to use in reference resolution
- Provide a hack so assemblies are copied to output folder on compilation
- Drop redundant references to old closed source gamepad bridge

data.title: Couple of Fixes for Windows
data.body:
Fix for the KeyboardUtil.cs
Fix for the Graphics Device handling a null returned from GL get extensions

data.title: Develop3d: Merge in all the simple changes from develop
data.body: It's easier if we periodically keep these aligned.

data.title: MonoDevelop project templates all have an Android icon
data.body: ProjectTemplates/MonoDevelop.MonoGame.2.5/icons/monogame-32.png is used for all MonoDevelop project types, including iOS, but this icon includes an overlaid Android robot. There should be one icon per template type.

data.title: some fixes to allow the Video to work on android.
Link error when compiling for Android (error finding Lidgren.Network.Android)
data.body:
I know this is something that appeared before, and sly submitted a pull request which should fix the issue, but I'm experiencing it right now.

I'm using the latest develop3d branch and Mono for Android version (4.2.2 , Evaluation), and MonoDevelop as the IDE. I get a Link error when compiling the Android Application project. Library projects compile just fine.

data.body:
OpenALSoundController.cs
iOSGameView.cs
And project template files

data.title: Setting presentation parameters at start has no effect
Initalizing Texture2D from a background thread => lock
data.body:
When loading a Texture2D from a thread (via ContentManager.Load<>), that thread gets locked.

I've checked a bit the internals and it looks like Threading.BlockOnUIThread() is called, resulting in the action added to a pending action list (so the UI thread can perform them later), but this never happens ( Threading.Run() is not even called once in MonoGame? )

data.title: Texture2D: Initialize textureData array

milestone.title: 2.5.1 Release
milestone.description: Bug Fix release for issues found in the 2.5 Release

data.title: Updated Libs submodule
WinRT Fixes & Threaded Loading
data.body:
I moved the dpi calculation so that it reacts to changes in simulator. 

I fixed the incorrect half pixel offset in SpriteBatch in WinRT.

We now lock() on d3dContext allowing for threading resource loading on WinRT.

We exposed event in Game when a Metro app's "view state" has changed.

data.title: make sure textures get properly disposed
map sticks and triggers to buttons
a few fixes to the new gamepad code
DisplayOrientation Support for WinRT
data.body: First pass at DisplayOrientation support for WinRT.  There are still a few things that are undocumented in the WinRT APIs that i'm not sure of...  I should have more to commit next week after our Microsoft meeting.

data.title: Develop3d
data.body: Got playing of non-3D SoundEffects working under WinRT

data.title: Songs are expanded to full PCM in memory regardless of file type
data.body:
In the latest dev branch, the Song type is now implemented the same as SoundEffect. The problem is that SoundEffect expands to full PCM data in memory, regardless of the originating file type. This is fine for SoundEffect because those are limited in XNA to .wav files, but bad for songs which can be compressed.

As an example, in my game, MonoGame was expanding my relatively tame 5.6MB .mp3 file into roughly 50MB in memory! This will obviously get worse the larger the file you have.

I do have a fix for this that simply reverts to using the monotouch AVAudioPlayer just for Songs, but I don't know enough about the design and future plans of MonoGame's audio subsystem to know if that is the right fix.

data.title: Update to WinRT Project Template
data.body:
Updated the WIinRT Project Template
I also fixed the line endings in the Windows8 project.

Apparently on windows we should be setting the following in git

git config --global core.autocrlf true

data.title: Update to WinRT Project Template
data.body: Updated the WinRT project Template.

data.title: Update to WinRT Project Template
Update to WinRT Project Template
data.body: Updated the Template with the new Assembly References.

data.title: Few Graphics Fixes
data.body:
Just a few things...

I removed the old XNA 3.x ResolveTexture2D class.

We now discard the render target content (via a clear) like XNA4 does when "DiscardContent" is set.

Fixed up GraphicsDevice.Clear() on WinRT to correctly detect depth and stencil buffers.

data.title: Refactored the GamePad code
data.body:
Refactored the GamePad code for Windows , Linux and Mac to not rely on the thirdParty Gamepad dlls.

This means there is not GamePad config screen at the moment, only AutoConfig is working, but it will allow MonoGame to be included in the next debian release.

Needs testing on Linux and Mac. Works OK with a standard USB joystick on windows
